This property is set to the image (if any) you specified at initialization time. If you did not use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImageView/init(image:highlightedImage:)] method to initialize your image view, the initial value of this property is `nil`.

# highlightedImage

**Instance Property**

The highlighted image displayed in the image view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var highlightedImage: UIImage? { get set }
```

## Discussion

The image in this property is displayed when the image view’s [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImageView/isHighlighted] property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. If the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImageView/highlightedAnimationImages] property contains a valid set of images, those image are used instead.

This property is set to the image (if any) you specified at initialization time. If you did not use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImageView/init(image:highlightedImage:)] method to initialize your image view, the initial value of this property is `nil`.

## Related Documentation

- **highlightedAnimationImages**: An array of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage] objects to use for an animation when the view is highlighted.

## Accessing the displayed images

- **image**: The image displayed in the image view.
